Authors: Sadewa A.W., Kaburuan E.R., Legowo N.
Title: Deploying cloud computing enterprise-based architecture using TOGAF (Case study: PT. XYZ)
Source title: International Journal of Control and Automation
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program -Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sadewa, A.W., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program -Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kaburuan, E.R., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program -Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Legowo, N., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program -Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Implementing cloud computing Enterprise-based architectures with the TOGAF framework and with a detailed explanation of the implementation of cloud Computing technology coupled with business architecture discusses what gaps need to be improved for cloud deployment Computing at large-scale companies. Cloud computing can be implemented at PT. XYZ due to minimal cost and no intensive maintenance needed to develop the application when it has data updates. Cloud computing technology should be used as the capability of the complex infrastructure progress of the server on premise requires very high maintenance costs as well as waste of resources, the presence of cloud computing offers unique characteristics to address the problems faced IT Department in the development system. © 2020 SERSC.
Author Keywords: Business architecture; Cloud Computing; Enterprise; Framework; TOGAF
